channel.title: Midtown East on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Midtown East on Table41NYC

item.title: Strip House
item.description: Steak was just OK. Service was slow as hell. Truffle cream of spinach was good.

item.title: American Cut
item.description: Decent for the price. This is Marc Forgione’s steak house.

item.title: 212 Steakhouse
item.description: Ok, this place is the only legit place in NYC that has real kobe certified beef from Japan. It was delicious and cheap… with the groupon.

item.title: Grand Central Oyster Bar
item.description: Pretty decent. Worth this 1 time trip and that’s about it. The oyster pan roast was alright. The soft shell crab was pretty decent too. I think I’d get the clam chowder over the oyster pan roast.

item.title: Shinshi Ramen
item.description: Pretty good tsukemen. Get the spicy miso. Tsukemen seems fairly rare in NYC. Still looking for something similar to LA Tsujita.

item.title: Momosan Ramen
item.description: It’s ok. Broth is not great, but tuna bowl is good. I think this restaurant is owned by Morimoto.

item.title: Fine and Rare
item.description: Jazzy loungy restaurant. Might be good for a date spot if you’re into dine and jazz, but the food was just OK.

item.title: Her Name Is Han
item.description: Pretty good Korean food. Fairly priced and family style. They have BOSSAM, and it was really good.

item.title: Tonkatsu Matsunoya
item.description: This place is pretty bomb and NO TIP NEEDED! Would come back here again. The crust was really good.

item.title: Cafe Zaiya
item.description: Decent black sesame bubble milk tea with red bean dessert bakery stuff.
